item.title: An Overview of Graduate Borrowing and Outcomes
item.description:
This comprehensive report, produced for the U.S. Department of Education’s Office of the Chief Economist, analyzes graduate student borrowing and outcomes using federal administrative data. The study provides critical insights for policymakers on graduate education financing and student success.

Key findings include analysis of:

  • Graduate student debt accumulation patterns
  • Post-graduation earnings and employment outcomes
  • Variation across programs and institutional types
  • Policy implications for federal student aid programs

Report Number: OCE2024-007

item.title: A Closer Look at College Affordability: The Link between Living Allowances and Student Debt
